description: From German Raster, from Latin rāster, from rāstrum (“rake”, noun), from rādere (“to scrape”, verb).

entries.meaning: (electronics) A scanning pattern of parallel lines that form the display of an image projected on a cathode-ray tube of a television set or display screen.
(computer graphics) A bitmap image, consisting of a grid of pixels, stored as a sequence of lines.

verbs.description: raster (third-person singular simple present rasters, present participle rastering, simple past and past participle rastered)
